page.title: 08Trade opinions,By-pass idea.
page.content: We surveyed most of the shops in the village to find their opinions on the traffic problems. The majority were not in favour of any changes as they thought the narrow road, parked cars and awkward corners caused traffic to go slowly and carefully. When a nearly motorway is completed it is expected that less heavy container lorries will need to come through Goudhurst. It was considered by many shopkeepers that the proposed by-pass would take trade away from the villge. Tourists would still be attracted to the area for its architecture and history, also by the tea rooms and inns. Goudhurst is noted for its good food, and is the nearest village of any size to many popular places such as Bedgebury Pinetum, Finchcocks museum of musical instruments, Bewl Vallley Water and Goudhursts historic church.
